description: Field chickweed (Cerastium arvense) is a resilient species of wildflower commonly found in pastures and fields. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family of plants and displays clusters of small white flowers. An attractive feature of field chickweed is its incredible hardiness; it will continue to bloom and thrive in any kind of terrain, from dry, sandy soil to the wettest climates. Its petite, delicate form and foliage make it a beautiful addition to any garden. One of the most amazing aspects of field chickweed is its medicinal properties. It is a known natural remedy for fevers, as well as digestive ailments, and can be brewed into a tea or soup. Field chickweed is a truly remarkable species.
